page.title: 08OLD BLACKSMITH IN CLAYPOLE
page.content: My great-grandad was a black- smith. He began work about 1920. He started down Barnby Lane and later on Main Street in Claypole. He would shoe about 20 horses a day and also at the surrounding villages of Stubton, Brandon, Foston, Allington, Wellingore and Barnby Manor. In small shops he would shoe local horses taking his mobile Forge to heat the shoes he had already made to fit horses hooves. He also repaired and made harrows and other Agricultural implements. He would reserve a day for hooping cart wheels as they had to be heated to fit the wheels of the carts. He retired in 1970 and we have no local blacksmith who shoes our horses today. The next page tells about the life of our present blacksmith.
